p.s: The excerpt at hand from the novel The Great Gatsby by F. Scott Fitzgerald, published in 1925, deals with the reunion of Daisy and Gatsby.
At the beginning of the scene Daisy arrives at Nick's house for the tea invitation and they have a little smalltalk.
When they go in, Nick notices that Gatsby is not in the living room anymore, he has gone out the backdoor to come in at the front door again now.
Gatsby is really nervous to see Daisy and the first minutes of their reunion are awkward.
Gatsby accidently almost breaks a clock.
He even tries to leave, but Nick puts him back in his place.
Then Nick leaves the house and leaves them to themselves.
While outside he looks at Gatsby's mansion and tells a story about how it was built.

When Nick returns to Daisy and Gatsby in his house, the awkward situation seems to have changed; Daisy had cried and Gatsby seems happy and enthusiastic, inviting Daisy and Nick to come over to his house to show them around.
